page.title: 03ANIMALS ON MARKLAND FARM
page.content: THERE ARE 55 FRIESIAN DAIRY COWS AND 50 HEIFERS WHICH ARE REARED TO REPLACE THE OLDER COWS.THERE IS AN 8 MONTH OLD BULL CALF.HOWEVER MOST BULL CALVES HE SELLS WHEN THEY ARE ONE OR TWO WEEKS OLD. WITHIN A DAY OF BEING BORN THE CALVES ARE TAKEN FROM THEIR MOTHERS AND KEPT INDOORS FOR MOST OF THE YEAR. THE COWS THEMSELVES ARE MILKED AT 7AM AND 5PM.THE MILK IS STORED IN A GAS COOLED TANK WHICH KEEPS THE MILK BELOW 5 DEGREES CENTIGRADE UNTIL IT IS COLLECTED EACH MORNING BY TANKER.THE MORNING OF OUR VISIT 833 LITRES WERE COLLECTED. THE COWS,FOR MOST OF THE YEAR,GRAZE ON THE PASTURE LAND,THOUGH IN WINTER THEY ARE KEPT IN THE CUBICLE HOUSE.WHILST BEING MILKED THE COWS ARE GIVEN EXTRA PROTEIN CONCENTRATE. ALSO HENS ARE KEPT FOR THEIR EGGS.
